sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"相似，类似"之意。
means: similarity ： 指不同的人或事物在外表、特征、程度或性质等方面有某些相似之处。
resemblance ： 指外观或性质有相似之处。
analogy ： 指外表或实质均不相同的事物对比之下的类似之处。
likeness ： 普通用词，指人或物从外观看去，有很明显的相似之处，或完全相似。

word_mean: 同功〔器官〕：在功能或外表上类似，而起源或发育则不同
功能相同，外表类似，但来源上不相同，结构不相同的器官。同功器官不说明在进化上有共同来源，只是具有相似的功能。

sentence.Network_en: The teacher drew an analogy between the human heart and a pump.
sentence.Network_cn: 老师打了个比喻，把人的心脏比作水泵。

sentence.Network_en: It is not always reliable to argue by analogy.
sentence.Network_cn: 靠类推法论证并不总是可靠的.

sentence.Network_en: A close analogy with the art of singing can be made.
sentence.Network_cn: 可以用歌唱艺术作类比.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense 'appropriateness, correspondence'): from French analogie, Latin analogia 'proportion', from Greek, from analogos 'proportionate'

entry.def: If you make or draw an analogy between two things, you show that they are similar in some way.

example.ex: It is probably easier to make an analogy between the courses of the planets, and two trains travelling in the same direction.
example.tran: 将行星的运行比作两列火车朝同一方向行驶可能更容易些。

means.word_mean: 1. an inference that if things agree in some respects they probably agree in others
2. drawing a comparison in order to show a similarity in some respect;

sentences.sentence: "the operation of a computer presents and interesting analogy to the working of the brain"
"the models show by analogy how matter is built up"

means.word_mean: 3. the religious belief that between creature and creator no similarity can be found so great but that the dissimilarity is always greater; language can point in the right direction but any analogy between God and humans will always be inadequate

auth_sentence.content: I feel that this analogy is invalid and confusing.
auth_sentence.res_content: I feel that this analogy is invalid and confusing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I feel that this analogy is invalid and confusing.

auth_sentence.content: How is the wateroxygen analogy not a straw-man argument?
auth_sentence.res_content: How is the wateroxygen analogy not a straw-man argument?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How is the wateroxygen analogy not a straw-man argument?

auth_sentence.content: You've noticed I haven't used that analogy.
auth_sentence.res_content: You've noticed I haven't used that analogy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You've noticed I haven't used that analogy.

sentences.en: Shakespeare makes an analogy between the citizens of country and the parts of a person's body.
sentences.cn: 莎士比亚把一个国家中的国民类比为人身体的各个部分。

sentences.en: There is an analogy between the way water moves in waves and the way light travels.
sentences.cn: 水的波动与光的运行有类似之处。

sentences.en: It is not always reliable to argue by analogy.
sentences.cn: 靠类推法论证并不总是可靠的。

sentences.en: He drew this conclusion on the analogy of yours.
sentences.cn: 他根据你的理论类推得出这个结论。

jushi.english: There is an analogy between learning and light.
The doctor drew an analogy between the human heart and a pump.
jushi.chinese: 这位医生把心脏比作泵。

jushi.english: Our manager is fond of drawing analogies between business and football.
jushi.chinese: 我们的经理喜欢把经商和足球作类比。
